result.execSummary:
The defendant Timothy James Maas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
BRANCH 28 HELD IN BRANCH 26.  Defendant Timothy James Maas in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Timothy James Maas in custody.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Firearms warning given.  Voting admonishment given.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, Defense, and Defendant.    

The Court sentenced the defendant to a TOTAL LENGTH of imprisonment of 30 months consecutive to any other sentence.
The INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons is 15 months with credit for 172 days time served.
The Court orders the defendant to serve a maximum term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 15 months.

Conditions of Extended Supervision to be determined by the Dept. of Corrections, but to include:

*
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with any treatment deemed necessary by the department.
*Random urine screens.  No positive results.
*No illegal drugs.
*No firearms.
*No contact with Marina M.

- Defendant ordered to submit a DNA sample if not already done.
- Defendant advised that he may never again possess firearms or weapons.
- Civil rights suspended until reinstated.  Order received and filed.
- Pay all costs and surcharges, including the mandatory DNA surcharge, out of up to 25% prison income, wages or assets, any balance as a condition of ES.  If not paid, a civil judgment to be entered.
- Defendant does qualify for the Challenge Incarceration Program and does qualify for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.


Appeal rights given.  
- Received and filed:  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence; Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
filed.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Timothy James Maas not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Adjournment of the plea/sentencing requested.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Timothy James Maas not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense is making a referral to drug treatment court.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Timothy James Maas in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Defendant Timothy James Maas in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Information received and filed.  Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of Not Guilty.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Timothy James Maas not in court, in custody.  Jeremy Arn for Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court sets bail in the amount of $1,500.00 cash TOT Justice Point with the same previous conditions of release.  Arraignment scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court, defendant Timothy James Maas not in court, in custody.  Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Matter unable to be heard today.  Matter reset for 8/18/2015 for Return on Warrant.  Return on warrant scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Attorney Lamke on vacation for when this case was originally set.  Matter reset for 8-17-15 @ 8:30 a.m. for Return on Warrant.

Bench warrant cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on August 9, 2015; Bench warrant in file.   Attorney Matt Lampke notified that his client was picked up on the bench warrant that was issued on July 10, 2015.  Matter scheduled for Return on Warrant in Br. 21.
Justice Point Discharge Summary Report received and filed.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($750.00 signature bond) gj

Defendant fails to appear.  Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued and ordered any bail on deposit be forfeited.
Attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke in court.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Original Information received and filed.

Defendant Timothy James Maas in court with attorney Matthew Adrian Lamke.  Joanne Hardtke for Megan Patricia Carmody appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   State requests an Arraignment date.  Arraignment scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 6/12/15.

Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Timothy James Maas in court with attorney Trisha Janet Fritz.  Defendant Timothy James Maas in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.   
Court advised Defendant he  may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).    
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
